2021-09-05T14:51:14Z: Thanks everyone for tuning in - we'll be back once again for the Italian Grand Prix at Monza! Have a pleasant afternoon!
2021-09-05T14:50:33Z: And here's the report of the Dutch GP: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/verstappen-takes-home-win-at-dutch-gp/6661121/
2021-09-05T14:48:59Z: If Nicholas Latifi eventually wins a race at Montreal, F1 HAS to rope Alanis Morrisette into proceedings somehow.
2021-09-05T14:47:22Z: Dispensing with the usual podium traditions, Davina Michelle gets an encore to sing the national anthem again.
2021-09-05T14:44:49Z: Verstappen is soaking up the adulation like a sponge, basking in the delight of the home crowd. It was only going to go one way today, really.
2021-09-05T14:41:58Z: Ex-F1 driver and sex toy entrepreneur Robert Doornbos is handling the post-race interviews.
2021-09-05T14:40:08Z: Naturally, Verstappen is back in control of the drivers' standings now.
2021-09-05T14:37:09Z: There's orange smoke absolutely everywhere as the flares are let off. The home fans are reasonably pleased, let's say.
2021-09-05T14:36:06Z: Leclerc is fifth, ahead of Alonso, Sainz, Perez, Ocon and Norris.
2021-09-05T14:35:42Z: Bottas completes the podium after his, ahem, fastest lap attempt, finishing ahead of Gasly, who keeps fourth with a sterling drive.
2021-09-05T14:34:58Z: Hamilton DOES get the fastest lap, a 1m11.097s, as he takes a conciliatory second place.
2021-09-05T14:34:34Z: And Alonso gets by Sainz on the final lap to take P6!
2021-09-05T14:34:07Z: The crowd goes ABSOLUTELY wild, as Max Verstappen wins the Dutch Grand Prix!
2021-09-05T14:33:22Z: Perez is up to P8, getting by Ocon late in this race. After the start he made to this race that is a solid recovery by the Mexican.
2021-09-05T14:32:33Z: Hamilton gets soft tyres now for an attempt at the fastest lap. This seems...unnecessary, given it was Hamilton's point anyway.
2021-09-05T14:32:31Z: Russell also pits late on, which at least allows him to serve his earlier five-second time penalty for speeding in the pitlane, which sees the Williams driver drop to P15.
2021-09-05T14:31:51Z: Bottas does set the fastest lap, however, a 1m12.549s. He was told to abort it, he doesn't, and now he's going to be in trouble...
2021-09-05T14:28:41Z: Bottas comes in for a second stop, for some reason. Hamilton has the fastest lap at the moment, and Mercedes won't be too willing to let Bottas take it...will they?
2021-09-05T14:28:28Z: Perez gets ahead of Norris to take P9 but it was a very physical fight. Norris, on the inside of Turn 1, has a couple of wheel-to-wheel nudges with Perez on his outside, with the Red Bull driver getting better drive to Turns 2 and 3 to make the move stick.
2021-09-05T14:26:25Z: That's another very slow lap for Leclerc, a 1m17.7s, compared to the mid-1m15s of the cars around him. He recovers with a 1m16.0s, but there must have been some kind of delay.
2021-09-05T14:25:26Z: Further ahead of the Perez/Norris battle Alonso is sizing up Sainz in the fight for sixth place.
2021-09-05T14:25:18Z: Leclerc did a moderately slow lap last time around, giving Gasly more breathing space as he hopes to keep P4 on aged mediums.
2021-09-05T14:24:09Z: Credit to Norris, he's been able to keep Perez at bay even as the Red Bull has had the DRS boost over the last two laps. If he can do it for another eight laps, P9 will be his.
2021-09-05T14:20:55Z: It looks as though Hamilton no longer has an answer for Verstappen out front, however, and continues to lose ground. The lead is now 4s.
2021-09-05T14:20:39Z: Perez is eating into the gap to Norris ahead by over a second per lap. The Red Bull is almost within DRS range now.
2021-09-05T14:19:24Z: But on lap 60, Verstappen and Hamilton have no traffic to contend with - the Dutchman adding another 0.4s to his advantage.
2021-09-05T14:18:24Z: Verstappen gets a nicer run with lapping Giovinazzi and Latifi, putting a second back on Hamilton.
2021-09-05T14:16:53Z: Traffic playing a big role in this lead battle here - it's like racing on the M25 at rush hour.
2021-09-05T14:13:43Z: Ricciardo's road block role against Perez doesn't last long as the Red Bull driver gets ahead into P10, making the move around the outside of Turn 1.
2021-09-05T14:13:39Z: Mercedes tells Hamilton to take it a little easy and cement a decent points haul. Hamilton tells his team that he'd rather go after Verstappen and try to win. We're paraphrasing slightly.
2021-09-05T14:11:52Z: Hamilton's now within two seconds of Verstappen now, so despite his earlier gripes, he's giving it a go.
2021-09-05T14:09:46Z: Gasly's going to have a job to get to the end on his mediums and keep fourth; Leclerc's coming back at him at a decent rate of knots.
2021-09-05T14:06:48Z: The Red Bull driver makes light work of getting by Russell, as Perez dives up the inside at Turn 11. He'll be chasing down both McLarens next, who switched Norris ahead of Ricciardo earlier, to climb back into the points.
2021-09-05T14:06:23Z: Hamilton does a 1m13.124s fastest lap. Called it.
2021-09-05T14:05:03Z: Perez pits for the second time in this race, taking on some fresh softs, and comes out in P12 right in between Russell and Stroll.
2021-09-05T14:03:59Z: Ocon reports he has a plastic bag stuck to his car, as TV replays show it breaking up into pieces and littering all over the track.
2021-09-05T14:01:36Z: Haas report Mazepin has retired from the race due to a hydraulic issue.
2021-09-05T14:00:24Z: The Dutch GP has its first race retirement. It is Mazepin in the Haas, who pulls into the pits and parks up.
2021-09-05T13:59:23Z: Kubica's stop means Norris is the last driver standing in terms of taking a trip to pitlane. But just to be annoying for us, the McLaren driver comes in on lap 43 to switch his mediums for hards and comes out in P11 - ahead of Russell and Stroll.
2021-09-05T13:57:07Z: Kubica finally makes his first pitstop, swapping his mediums for hards on lap 41. The Pole, replacing Raikkonen who tested positive for COVID-19 on Saturday morning, comes out in P18.
2021-09-05T13:56:58Z: Hamilton logged a 1m13.292s last time out as the Mercedes driver tries to close the gap on Verstappen - which is 3s as it stands.
2021-09-05T13:54:43Z: Hamilton gets dumped into a bunch of traffic, giving Verstappen free license to pit. Hard tyres for the Red Bull.
2021-09-05T13:53:39Z: Hamilton, however, responds and comes in for pitstop number two for fresh mediums. That's somewhat early, given we've just passed half-distance.
2021-09-05T13:51:51Z: Verstappen's now opened up the lead once more, adding 0.5s to the gap on the previous lap.
2021-09-05T13:51:49Z: Vettel suffers a half-spin all on his own at the bowl Turn 3, with Bottas having to slam on the anchors to avoid the sideways Aston Martin. Thankfully both avoid any further danger aside from losing a chunk of time.
2021-09-05T13:50:02Z: Giovinazzi has pitted again as he has picked up a puncture - meaning he has dropped down to P18. Disaster for Alfa Romeo as the Italian had been fighting for a points finish this afternoon.
2021-09-05T13:48:07Z: Leclerc makes his stop, rejoining in fifth behind Gasly - so the status quo returns to the top six.
2021-09-05T13:47:18Z: On lap 35 Alonso pits and returns to the action in P9, still ahead of his Alpine team-mate Ocon.
2021-09-05T13:45:52Z: Russell has been given a five-second time penalty for speeding in the pitlane. That'll wreck his hopes of fighting for points.
2021-09-05T13:45:06Z: A lap later Ocon and Tsunoda pit. Ocon comes out in P10 ahead of Ricciardo, with Tsunoda now P17 behind both Aston Martins.
2021-09-05T13:45:07Z: Hard tyres for Sainz too, suggesting Ferrari's going for the one-stop.
2021-09-05T13:44:34Z: Sainz now pits too, and will rejoin behind Alonso in seventh place.
2021-09-05T13:44:02Z: Bottas finally pits, having played his part in the production.
2021-09-05T13:43:30Z: At the end of lap 30 Ricciardo is the next to pit, coming back out in P12, but more importantly ahead of those behind him who had already pitted.
2021-09-05T13:42:48Z: Bottas also lets Hamilton through, allowing the lead battle to resume.
2021-09-05T13:42:26Z: But although Hamilton has closed in on the pair, Verstappen gets a lovely tow along the final corner and retakes the lead, relegating Bottas down a spot.
2021-09-05T13:41:15Z: Verstappen has now caught Bottas - and at a good time, as he's been able to drop Hamilton to buy some time.
2021-09-05T13:40:23Z: Gasly has returned to the top six after cruising around the outside of Alonso at Turn 1, so he'll be putting the Ferraris under pressure once more in short order.
2021-09-05T13:39:52Z: Pitstop time! Giovinazzi, Russell and Stroll all come in together. Russell comes within a car length of jumping Giovinazzi in the pits but just misses out on a net P10.
2021-09-05T13:36:11Z: Hamilton has chipped another two-tenths out of Verstappen now, as Bottas is struggling out front on his tyres.
2021-09-05T13:34:51Z: Gasly now makes his first stop as Leclerc has homed in on the AlphaTauri driver, taking on the mediums.
2021-09-05T13:34:23Z: Perez is keeping things entertaining though, as he gets by Tsunoda up the inside at Turn 11 to take P14. He likes that corner.
2021-09-05T13:33:18Z: All calm in the midfield fight, for now, with nobody looking to pit just yet. So expect them all to opt for the one-stop strategy.
2021-09-05T13:32:22Z: After the outlaps, Hamilton has cut the gap by about 2s as Verstappen gets his new mediums up to temperature.
2021-09-05T13:31:15Z: Verstappen responds, coming into the pits for mediums as well. He covers off Hamilton, rejoining in second.
2021-09-05T13:30:24Z: Lots of clean air for Hamilton to rejoin into, crucially ahead of Gasly, as he only drops one place.
2021-09-05T13:29:33Z: Given how far out of position Perez is in his Red Bull, it is a bit unfair on the midfield runners he's overtaking. Kubica is his next victim, around the outside at Turn 1, to move up to P15.
2021-09-05T13:29:23Z: Hamilton is the first of the front-runners to blink, coming in to stop. The softs come off, and the mediums come on.
2021-09-05T13:27:35Z: Perez is pushing on after his tough start to the race. On lap 19 he goes around the outside of Latifi at Turn 11 to take P16.
2021-09-05T13:23:41Z: Hamilton and Verstappen have matched each other this time around, but maybe Mercedes are getting cold feet over a two-stop...
2021-09-05T13:23:28Z: Perez is the next to be get by Mazepin, up the inside at Turn 11, to take P17.
2021-09-05T13:22:24Z: Hamilton lost 0.5s to Verstappen on the previous lap - the Red Bull driver looks to be very much in control here.
2021-09-05T13:21:28Z: An overtake on track to report - as we've not seen any since the first lap - Latifi passes Mazepin around the outside at the first corner to take P16.
2021-09-05T13:18:44Z: Perez is finding life on the mediums much better as he sets a fastest lap of 1m14.596s.
2021-09-05T13:17:33Z: At the end of lap 11 Vettel is the next to pit, swapping his softs for hards, so that'll be a long stint coming up - potentially he might even try to get to the end of the race on that set.
2021-09-05T13:15:55Z: On lap nine Perez pits switching his hards for the mediums. He did flat spot his fronts a few laps ago, which is the likely reason for that call, and it'll put him at risk of being lapped very soon.
2021-09-05T13:15:54Z: Hamilton sets a 1m14.750s to try and close up on Verstappen, a new fastest lap so far.
2021-09-05T13:14:59Z: Leclerc gets the call to switch to Plan B, so Ferrari's going to mix it up a touch.
2021-09-05T13:13:43Z: After a lengthy pitstop for Schumacher he is already being lapped by the leaders. Lapping in traffic could become a bigger factor as this race progresses.
2021-09-05T13:12:42Z: Gasly's six seconds off Bottas, but doing a very good job to sit four seconds clear of Leclerc.
2021-09-05T13:11:57Z: Alonso is favouring the high line at Turn 3 and keeps Ocon's attacks at bay for now. Ocon has already given his team-mate the hurry up over his Alpine team radio.
2021-09-05T13:10:23Z: Schumacher pits early, it looks like he picked up some damage in the opening exchanges with team-mate Mazepin. Perhaps that was a hangover of their qualifying squabble.
2021-09-05T13:09:46Z: DRS is enabled, but the front six are too spaced out to take advantage.
2021-09-05T13:08:39Z: TV replays did catch some close calls in the midfield, with the Alpines and Russell just avoiding contact between Turns 2 and 3. It was very tight but they avoid something scary, as Alonso rides around the outside at Turn 3.
2021-09-05T13:07:33Z: Verstappen begins lap 3 with a 2s lead over Hamilton already, delighting the home fans.
2021-09-05T13:05:35Z: As you were in the top six - Verstappen from Hamilton, Bottas, Gasly, Leclerc and Sainz.
2021-09-05T13:05:16Z: All very well behaved by the entire grid at the start with no obvious contact or clashes. Giovinazzi has made a bad start dropping from P7 to P10 overtaken by Alonso, Ocon and Ricciardo.
2021-09-05T13:04:37Z: That's a very clean start out front, Verstappen just disappears and leaves Hamilton for dust!
2021-09-05T13:04:04Z: And the Dutch Grand Prix begins!
2021-09-05T13:03:11Z: Perez and Latifi sitting patiently at the end of pits ahead of their pitlane start. The Red Bull driver starts ahead of the Williams.
2021-09-05T13:00:11Z: And away, for the formation lap.
2021-09-05T12:58:39Z: Tyre news: Russell, Norris, Kubica, Mazepin and Latifi on mediums, Perez on hards, the rest begin on soft tyres.
2021-09-05T12:57:34Z: For Hot Fuzz fans, Zandvoort approximately translates to Sandford. Let's hope the swan's not escaped...
2021-09-05T12:54:49Z: Ah, the Twitter feed's working now. Sorry for the flood of tweets, for those who follow us there!
2021-09-05T12:51:35Z: This will please you all: risk of rain at 0%.
2021-09-05T12:51:01Z: Good to see there's a concerted dress code in the stands. I haven't seen this much orange since I accidentally watched Desperate Housewives...
2021-09-05T12:49:21Z: The atmosphere at the track is pumping once again. Just over 10 minutes until we get going at Zandvoort.
2021-09-05T12:47:03Z: On the scale of Eurovision-ness of this year's anthems, that was probably...not up there. Which isn't necessarily a bad thing.
2021-09-05T12:40:02Z: Daniel Ricciardo had a small puff of smoke emanating from the rear of his McLaren. Could just be a slight oil overfill, McLaren's mechanics don't look too worried.
2021-09-05T12:39:01Z:
The other Red Bull of Sergio Perez, along with Nicholas Latifi in the Williams, will start from the pitlane. Here's the latest, along with other stories:

Perez and Latifi set for F1 Dutch GP pitlane starts
Steiner: Neither Haas driver to blame for latest falling out
Mercedes facing ‘odd’ struggles through banked Turn 3 at Zandvoort
2021-09-05T12:38:03Z: Christian Horner reckons the engine cover off-ness on Max's car is just standard procedure. All good, we presume.
2021-09-05T12:36:18Z: Red Bull did change the DRS actuator over night, after his DRS wasn't able to open up at the end of his Q3 pole lap. Suspect he won't be using it too much, other than for lapped traffic.
2021-09-05T12:34:43Z: Red Bull taking a look at Verstappen's power unit, it seems - the top part of the engine cover is slightly lifted off. Doesn't look too concerning though.
2021-09-05T12:32:46Z: This being the first Dutch GP since 1985, the energy of the home fans has been something to behold. The flares wouldn't be out of place at a Galatasaray match.
2021-09-05T12:29:20Z: Hello everybody, and welcome to the Autosport Live coverage for the Dutch Grand Prix! In 30 minutes' time, it'll be all systems go at Zandvoort.
